image.altText: Concept art showing interior of sports stadium with cricket match underway.

props.synopsis: Cricket authorities have penned a bombshell letter to the Tasmanian government expressing reservations about the stadium's roof in its current design, saying the "stadium is unlikely to be conducive to hosting test matches" while requesting a return to the drawing board.

title.children: Macquarie Point stadium roof in doubt, as cricket raises 'significant concerns'

image.altText: Close up of hands sorting bunches of newly delivered daffodils.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Cancer Council has supported more than 2,000 people statewide impacted by cancer in the past 12 months, but the group says it's largely reliant on donations from the community. It's hopeful a call for government funding will help.

title.children: As demand on services grows, Tasmania's peak cancer charity calls for funds

image.altText: Aerial view of green oval surrounded by colourful houses on the coast with ocean and beach in the foreground.

props.synopsis: This year the small north-west town of Penguin celebrates its 150th anniversary. What started as a settlement trading timber and potatoes by sea has turned into a bustling tourist town.Â

title.children: From timber and potatoes to tourism, Penguin celebrates 150 years

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor pushes through legislation that could derail a legal battle over salmon farming's impact on an endangered ray and safeguard the industry's future in Tasmania.

title.children: Changes to laws pass lower house in attempt to protect salmon jobs

image.altText: Text message graphic.

props.synopsis: Hobart tenant Katie found out the "sublet agreement" she had signed with a company called Arx Pty Ltd could be invalid â and she had no tenancy rights in Tasmania.

title.children: A sharehouse was run by a 'sublandlord' company. It could be unlawful

image.altText: Close-up of grapes on vine, with row of netted grapes vines in background.

props.synopsis: While growers say they are always anxious about the risk of smoke taint from bushfires and burn-offs, conditions in Tasmania are ripening for a bumper wine grape harvest this year.

title.children: Amid weather 'whims', Tassie grape growers expect a bumper harvest

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump speaking in front of the red and white stripes of a US flag.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump defends the top adviser who inadvertently looped a magazine editor into a war group chat, saying he'd "learned a lesson" from the "glitch".

title.children: 'Learned a lesson': Trump defends aide's group chat 'glitch'

image.altText: Grey, blue, pink and yellow egg cartons sit for sale on a shelf

props.synopsis: After making the price of eggs a key election issue, Donald Trump is importing them from as far away as Turkiye and South Korea to tackle continuing shortages.

title.children: Donald Trump is shopping for hundreds of millions of eggs

image.altText: A tank with smoke visible nearby

props.synopsis: Talks in Saudi Arabia between delegations from the United States and Russia have again failed to produce a comprehensive ceasefire between Moscow and Kyiv, although separate deals to cement an informal truce already in place in the Black Sea was signed.

title.children: Russia-Ukraine ceasefire flops again after hours of talks 'about nothing'

image.altText: A high-up shot of Parramatta's CBD during a cloudy wet day

props.synopsis: A mass of tropical air forecast to engulf Australia's east coast is set to bring more days of uncomfortable humidity alongside the chance of flooding rains.

title.children: Pseudo-monsoon delivers humidity and flooding rains to Queensland and NSW

image.altText: moody image of 50- and 100-dollar notes laid out over bank statements

props.synopsis: The federal budget includes a "modest" tax cut for every taxpayer, starting from next year.

title.children: Tax cut calculator: find out how the new cuts will affect you

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers arrives on budget day

props.synopsis: Have you ever seen a treasurer, obliged on budget night to confirm that the national books have slid $42b into the red on his watch, looking quite so incredibly chipper?

title.children: Consider this the treasurer's refusal to sign a non-compete clause

image.altText: Pope Francis on the balcony at a hospital in Rome

props.synopsis: After a breathing crisis that involved the pontiff nearly choking on his vomit, "there was a real risk he might not make it," said Sergio Alfieri, a physician at Rome's Gemelli hospital.

title.children: Pope was so ill doctors considered letting him die

image.altText: A phone displaying a text that reads "hi Mum, it's me! Phones broken. Using this temp for now, how are you?"

props.synopsis: Three years on from when the first "Hi Mum" texts appeared on Australian mobile phones, parents are still falling for this emotive scam.

title.children: Calls to charity from 'Hi Mum' victims jump as text scam persists

image.altText: A board at the Australian Securities Exchange showing red and green stocks during trade.

props.synopsis: Uncertainty over President Donald Trump's tariff regime leads to the lowest consumer confidence score in four years. Wall St appears unfazed as all major indexes closed higher. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Businesses react to non-compete ban, ASX to open higher, Wall St gains

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Everyone's a winner': the budget with no losers
ACCI criticises budget for lacking vision and small business support
Chamber of Commerce criticises bans on non-compete clauses

image.altText: A single rose placed on a riot shield in a line of police officers at night.

props.synopsis: Protesters have taken to the streets in recent days after the arrest of a leading political opponent to TÃ¼rkiye's longtime leader Tayyip Erdogan.

title.children: TÃ¼rkiye protests enter seventh day as Erdogan insists 'show' will end

image.altText: A man in a suit with a red tie speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: Multiple times in his quest to become premier, David Crisafulli told voters a new stadium wasn't in his plans â yesterday, he announced one that will cost more than $3 billion.

title.children: David Crisafulli has broken a promise, but will anyone care in the long run?

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Senior Sergeant Jay Notaro in front of the water police building at the Southport Spit.

props.synopsis: Authorities are searching for prominent South East Queensland police officer Jay Notaro, after his surfboard was found abandoned on a northern NSW beach.Â

title.children: Search resumes for Qld police officer missing near Byron Bay

image.altText: woman taking a selfie in a car

props.synopsis: Ahmad Hodroj pleads guilty to the domestic violence manslaughter of his estranged wife and mother of three Amira Moughnieh in their Sydney home.

title.children: Murder charge dropped as Sydney man pleads guilty to wife's DV manslaughter

image.altText: Pete Hegseth is surrounded by reporters holding microphones and phones.

props.synopsis: End-to-end encrypted messaging app Signal is secure for everyday use but shouldn't be used by government officials to have conversations regarding national security, cyber security experts say.

title.children: Signal is 'as safe as messaging apps get', but not for national security

image.altText: Tony Popovic has his thumb up

props.synopsis: With six points out of six and an extension to Tony Popovic's unbeaten start to life as Socceroos coach, Australia is daring to dream of a stress-free passage to the 2026 FIFA World Cup. But the job is not done yet, not by a long shot.

title.children: Socceroos can dream of World Cup qualification, but not yet

image.altText: A group of soccer players stand in a circle on the filed to celebrate

props.synopsis: The Socceroos have taken another step towards World Cup qualification with a comfortable 2-0 victory against China in front of a record crowd in Hangzhou.Â

title.children: Horror goalkeeper error helps Socceroos silence record Chinese crowd

image.altText: Aerial view of water and station in Queensland

props.synopsis: More heavy rainfall is forecast after a drenching in outback and north Queensland closes roads and strands inland residents.

title.children: Outback towns now 'islands' as record-breaking rain continues

image.altText: Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen in a blue dress.

props.synopsis: Mette Frederiksen hit out after it emerged that a delegation including Usha Vance, wife of vice president JD Vance, White House National Security Adviser Mike Waltz and Energy Secretary Chris Wright will make an unsolicited visit to the country.Â

title.children: Trump team putting 'unacceptable pressure' on Greenland, says Danish PM

image.altText: Actor Gerard Depardieu attends a news conference and points his finger at the crowd.

props.synopsis: The French actor has taken the stand in Paris, where he is on trial for sexual assault during the filming of Les Volets Verts in 2021.Â

title.children: Gerard Depardieu admits grabbing woman by hips but denies assault

image.altText: A woman smiles with arms folded and road behind her

props.synopsis: In Sydney's inner city, three former tunnelling sites remain vacant and unused. The NSW government has ruled out setting aside the lots for social housing â a decision some suggest is wrong.

title.children: 'Absolute waste': Housing crisis fuels debate over rare Sydney properties

image.altText: Piles of cigarettes in a Melbourne warehouse

props.synopsis: The tobacco excise has seen cigarettes taxes become a lucrative source of revenue for the federal government, pouring billions into its coffers each year.

title.children: Booming trade in illegal cigarettes costing the budget billions

image.altText: Kings Cross Stills of buildings and signs with people walking around the streets.

props.synopsis: Privacy rights have been raised after a content creator from the United States covertly filmed women in Sydney using smart glasses. These are your rights when it comes to being filmed or recorded in public.

title.children: If someone films you in public, these are your rights

image.altText: The 23andMe logo seen on a smartphone

props.synopsis: The genomic testing company says the way it stores data hasn't changed and any new buyers would have to follow the "applicable law" about security.Â

title.children: What does 23andMe's collapse mean for customers' data?

image.altText: A mob of sheep in a yard.

props.synopsis: Scientists call for the federal government to invest more in preventing the disease from spreading to Australia's $5 billion sheep meat industry.

title.children: Australia on alert after UK detects world's first case of bird flu in sheep

image.altText: A blindfolded man is loaded into the back of a van at night time

props.synopsis: A documentary maker is among three Palestinians beaten and detained in the West Bank, according to a co-director who says he witnessed the arrest.Â

title.children: Oscar-winning director beaten by Israeli settlers, witnesses say

image.altText: Man in a formal blue suit speaking at a podium with "SAMSUNG" logo.

props.synopsis: Han Jong-hee, the co-CEO of South Korean tech giant Samsung Electronics has died at age 63.

title.children: Samsung Electronics co-CEO dies, leaving new appointee in charge

image.altText: An old woman and a little girl listening to music with headphones

props.synopsis: Music lovers show how special musical memories are, with recollections going back decades. Here's how music from childhood can form lifelong memories

title.children: Unlike words and faces, musical memories donât fade with time
